Test locally and verify the behavior.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y]Status.NuGet.Org must not use meta refresh" (#7855) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
@ryuyu commented on [Thu Feb 27 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/3018)

Currently, the status page uses a <meta> tag to cause the page to refresh.

This is not a11y compliant.
The page should be updated to use a javascript refresh instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] Only “Browse” tab can’t show the embedded icon of the package from DevOps feed" (#9250) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.6.0.6479
VS Version: Master\29902.138
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1.	Create a Console App (.NET Core 3.1) in VS and open the PM UI of the solution.
2.	Add the [DevOps feed](https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/farhub/_packaging/farhub/nuget/v3/index.json ) into the Settings->NuGet Package Manager->Package Sources.
3.  Select the new added DevOps feed in the Package source dropdown box in the PM UI and install the package [**classlib.net48 -version 1.0.5** (don’t have the backlash problem in bug 9225), **dotnet.icon -version 1.0.0** (embedded icon)]
4.  Check all the tabs in PM UI. 
## Expected
The embedded icon should show correctly in all the tabs of PM UI.
## Actual
Only “Browse” tab can’t show the embedded icon of the package from DevOps feed as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/75776381-df38c400-5d8e-11ea-93ce-c4cda3a6d87e.png)

## Note
It doesn't repro for the nuget.org feed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure] Lock file will not update after changing the project graph structure until reopening the solution" (#9256) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Release-5.6.0-Preview.1\5.6.0.6483
VS Version: D16.6\29903.66
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1. Create a solution with three .NET Core Class Library projects, make the project graph structure: Lib1 -> Lib2 -> Lib3 (Lib1 reference Lib2 reference Lib3) through “Add reference” context menu in Solution Explorer.  
2. Set property “RestorePackagesWithLockFile” to true in csproj file (as below) of Lib1.
`<RestorePackagesWithLockFile>true</RestorePackagesWithLockFile> `
3. Check the lock file and close the solution.
4. Reopen the solution and check the lock file again.
5. Change the project graph structure: Lib1 -> Lib2 & Lib3 through “Add reference” context menu in Solution Explorer (no project reference for Lib2).
6. Clink the solution context menu “Restore NuGet Packages” in Solution Explorer and check the lock file again.
## Expected
Lock file will update correctly after changing the project graph structure.
## Actual
Lock file will not update after changing the project graph structure until reopening the solution as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/75872009-64cc7a80-5e48-11ea-943e-5e9ff4872d0f.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
